content.text: On index.html, I want to change the colors of the client testimonial cards. I want the background to be html code 272AF5 and the text to be white

The user wants to change the colors of client testimonial cards in index.html. They want:
- Background color: 272AF5 (which is a blue color)
- Text color: white

But the opened file is careers.html. I need to first look at index.html to find the testimonial cards and see how they're styled. Let me read that file first.
I need to continue reading to find the testimonial cards section.

content.text:
Now I can see the testimonial card structure. Looking at the code:

1. Line 446 shows the testimonial card uses `class="carousel-card card"`
2. The `.card` class is defined in the style section (lines 182-204)
3. The testimonial-specific text classes are defined on lines 206-208

Current `.card` styles (lines 182-204):
- border: 1px solid #1e3a8a;
- background: #001f3f;  (dark blue)
- color: #ffffff; (white)

The user wants:
- Background: 272AF5 (blue)
- Text: white

I need to find where the testimonial card styling is applied. The testimonial card uses both `.carousel-card` and `.card` classes. Looking at the styling, the `.card` class has the background color `#001f3f`. 

I need to change:
1. The `.card` background color from `#001f3f` to `#272AF5`
2. Text is already white, so that's good

Actually, looking more carefully, the user wants to change the client testimonial cards specifically. The testimonial card is on line 446 with class `carousel-card card`. The `.card` class controls the styling.

Let me update the `.card` background color from `#001f3f` to `#272AF5` (which is 272AF5, but in CSS it should be #272AF5).

Wait, the user said "html code 272AF5" - I think they mean the hex code 272AF5, so in CSS that would be #272AF5.

Looking at line 185:
```
background: #001f3f;
```

I need to change this to:
```
background: #272af5;
```

The text color is already white (#ffffff on line 188 and #e5e7eb for some text elements), so that's already correct. But let me check the testimonial-specific styles... 

I'm concerned about modifying all card styles when the user only wants changes to the client testimonial cards. The page uses `.card` class in multiple sections, including the Why 3N section. I'll need a targeted approach to modify only the testimonial carousel cards without affecting other page elements.

Potential solutions include:
- Creating a more specific CSS selector for testimonial cards
- Adding a unique class to the testimonial carousel cards
- Using a more targeted CSS rule that only applies to the specific carousel section

I'll need to carefully implement the color change to ensure it only affects the intended cards.

input.old_string: <div id="testimonial-carousel" class="carousel-card card" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 2rem auto;">
input.new_string: <div id="testimonial-carousel" class="carousel-card card" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 2rem auto; background: #272AF5; color: white;">

443→ Our performance is continuously evaluated. Below are excerpts from formal client satisfaction surveys. 444→

445→ 446→
447→

449→ "3N delivered tremendous value" 450→

-

content.text:
Great! I've successfully modified the testimonial carousel card to have the background color #272AF5 and white text. The change has been applied to the inline style attribute of the testimonial carousel div. This ensures the testimonial cards will display with the requested styling while keeping all other cards unchanged.

Since the user also asked about the text being white, I added `color: white;` to ensure all text in the testimonial card is white, which overrides the individual text color settings for elements within it.
Done. Changed the testimonial card background to #272AF5 with white text.
I want to instead change the color of the background to the same color of blue as the word "Delivered" on index.html

content.text: I want to instead change the color of the background to the same color of blue as the word "Delivered" on index.html

The user wants to change the testimonial card background to match the color of the word "Delivered" in the hero section. Let me look at the code to find what color "Delivered" uses.

Looking at the HTML, the word "Delivered" is in a span with class "hero-highlight". Let me find the CSS for that class:

Line 91: `.hero-highlight { color: #38bdf8; }`

So the color of "Delivered" is #38bdf8. I need to update the testimonial carousel background from #272AF5 to #38bdf8.

input.old_string: <div id="testimonial-carousel" class="carousel-card card" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 2rem auto; background: #272AF5; color: white;">
input.new_string: <div id="testimonial-carousel" class="carousel-card card" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 2rem auto; background: #38bdf8; color: white;">

content.text: I want all of the text color in the client testimonial cards to be black

The user wants all text in the client testimonial cards to be black. I need to:

1. Change the inline style on the testimonial-carousel div to have `color: black;` instead of `color: white;`
2. Potentially update the CSS for the testimonial-related classes like `.testimonial-quote`, `.testimonial-client`, and `.testimonial-ratings` to ensure they're black

Let me first read the current state of the file to see what we're working with, then make the necessary changes.

I can see the testimonial CSS classes:
- `.testimonial-quote` has `color: #e5e7eb;` (light gray)
- `.testimonial-client` has `color: #ffffff;` (white)
- `.testimonial-ratings` has `color: #d1d5db;` (light gray)

I need to change all of these to black. I'll update these CSS classes to have `color: #000000;` (or just `black` or `#000;`). I should also update the inline style on the testimonial-carousel div to use `color: black;`.

Let me update all of these.
Now I also need to update the inline style on the testimonial-carousel div to change `color: white;` to `color: black;` (or `#000000`).

input.old_string: <div id="testimonial-carousel" class="carousel-card card" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 2rem auto; background: #38bdf8; color: white;">
input.new_string: <div id="testimonial-carousel" class="carousel-card card" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 2rem auto; background: #38bdf8; color: black;">

content.text:
Perfect! I've updated all the testimonial text colors to black:
1. Updated `.testimonial-quote` from `#e5e7eb` to `#000000`
2. Updated `.testimonial-client` from `#ffffff` to `#000000`
3. Updated `.testimonial-ratings` from `#d1d5db` to `#000000`
4. Updated the inline style on the testimonial carousel from `color: white` to `color: black`

All done!
Done. Updated all testimonial text colors to black.

content.text: We have another testimonial card I want to add to the Client Testimonials section in index.html, and I want this to be the first testimonial card that a user sees:
Higher Education Institute ~ Director of Procurement:
“3N has truly been a pleasure to work with. They produced quality work that was not only meaningful, and
informative, it was actionable as well”
·      Client Satisfaction Survey Rating:
·       Quality of Work: “Exceptional”
·       Management Team: “Exceptional”
·       Cost Control: “Exceptional”
·       Schedule Management: “Exceptional”

The user wants to add a new testimonial card to the Client Testimonials section in index.html, and they want it to be the first testimonial that appears when the page loads.

Looking at the code, I can see that there's a testimonial carousel with JavaScript that manages which testimonial is displayed. The testimonials array is on lines 616-632. Currently there are 3 testimonials:
1. State Education Agency ~ Project Executive
2. State Treasurer's Office ~ Deputy State Treasurer  
3. CEO, Cosmetics, Health and Beauty Products Manufacturing firm

I need to:
1. Add the new testimonial to the beginning of the testimonials array (so it becomes the first one - index 0)
2. This will automatically make it the first testimonial shown since `currentTestimonial = 0` at the start

Let me add this new testimonial to the beginning of the array.
I can see the testimonials array. I need to add the new testimonial at the beginning of this array. I'll insert it before the "State Education Agency" testimonial.

content.output:
614→ 615→ // Testimonial carousel 616→ const testimonials = [ 617→ { 618→ client: "Higher Education Institute ~ Director of Procurement", 619→ quote: "3N has truly been a pleasure to work with. They produced quality work that was not only meaningful, and informative, it was actionable as well", 620→ ratings: 'Quality of Work: "Exceptional"
Management Team: "Exceptional"
Cost Control: "Exceptional"
Schedule Management: "Exceptional"' 621→ }, 622→ { 623→ client: "State Education Agency ~ Project Executive", 624→ quote: "3N delivered tremendous value", 625→ ratings: 'Quality of Work: "Exceptional"
Management Team: "Exceptional"
Cost Control: "Exceptional"
Schedule Management: "Very Good"' 626→ },

--- /Users/anupeesay/PycharmProjects/3NWebsite2/index.html +++ /Users/anupeesay/PycharmProjects/3NWebsite2/index.html @@ -615,6 +615,11 @@ // Testimonial carousel const testimonials = [ { + client: "Higher Education Institute ~ Director of Procurement", + quote: "3N has truly been a pleasure to work with. They produced quality work that was not only meaningful, and informative, it was actionable as well", + ratings: 'Quality of Work: "Exceptional"
Management Team: "Exceptional"
Cost Control: "Exceptional"
Schedule Management: "Exceptional"' + }, + { client: "State Education Agency ~ Project Executive", quote: "3N delivered tremendous value", ratings: 'Quality of Work: "Exceptional"
Management Team: "Exceptional"
Cost Control: "Exceptional"
Schedule Management: "Very Good"'

content.text: Good! I also need to update the total testimonial count in the HTML. Let me check what the current counter shows - it says "1 / 3" but now it should be "1 / 4". Actually, looking at the code, the total is displayed as `3` on line 463. I need to update that to 4.
Now I need to update the total testimonial count from 3 to 4:

content.output:
459→ 460→
461→ 462→
463→ 1 / 4 464→
465→ 466→
467→

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- /Users/anupeesay/PycharmProjects/3NWebsite2/index.html +++ /Users/anupeesay/PycharmProjects/3NWebsite2/index.html @@ -460,7 +460,7 @@
- 1 / 3 + 1 / 4

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully:
1. Added the new testimonial from "Higher Education Institute ~ Director of Procurement" as the first item in the testimonials array
2. Updated the total testimonial count from 3 to 4

Since `currentTestimonial = 0` and the new testimonial is at index 0, it will automatically be the first testimonial shown to users when they load the page.
Done. Added the new testimonial as the first card and updated the total count to 4.

They produced quality work that was not only meaningful, and informative, it was actionable as well%22,%0A      ratings: 'Quality of Work: %22Exceptional%22%3Cbr%3EManagement Team: %22Exceptional%22%3Cbr%3ECost Control: %22Exceptional%22%3Cbr%3ESchedule Management: %22Exceptional%22'%0A    %7D,%0A    %7B%0A
